chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy R Zasada was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Timothy R Zasada is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Timothy R Zasada was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Timothy R Zasada was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $850 bail applied. Remaining costs and fine amount to be paid while on probation. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.
Defendant to submit to random testing.
Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  
Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.
Defendant to submit DNA sample while in custody.
Pay supervision fees. 
2 days credit, if revoked.

timeConds.notes:
Court grants request to transfer to Fond du Lac County if both sheriff departments agree to transfer.
Work release authorized

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 03-10-2016 01:45 pm

Defendant Timothy R Zasada in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed. Counsel requests to adjourn sentencing. Court examines defendant, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. State moves to dismiss counts 2 and 4. State recommends on count 3 a withheld sentence (1yr probation with 45 days condition time with additional conditions, $450 fine plus costs, 16mo license revocation and ignition interlock). State recommends $300 fine plus costs on count 1. Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-04-2016 09:00 am
Court grants adjournment request. Plea/sentencing adjourned to 2/4/16.

Defendant Timothy R Zasada in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Alme Boaz requests a plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Timothy R Zasada in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel received copy of amended complaint, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty.  Further proceedings scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 10:00 am.
